sentences.en: "Why don't you wear your jogging shorts Mum?" — "Well, my legs are too skinny, if you must know."
sentences.cn: “妈妈，为什么不穿你的慢跑短裤呢？”——“哦，如果你非要问的话，因为我的腿太瘦了。”

sentences.en: At school I was fairly skinny and undersized.
Compare thin, skinny , underweight , slim, etc.
sentences.cn: 试比较thin 、 skinny、underweight 、 slim等词的用法.
他高高的个子,长得极瘦.

sentences.en: He looks much too skinny / scrawny to be a weight - lifter.
sentences.cn: 他瘦骨嶙峋的,当不了举重运动员.
他又点燃了那根剩下不多的雪茄.

sentences.en: He set his skinny legs apart and threw back his shoulders.
sentences.cn: 他叉开两条细腿，猛地挺起胸膛。

sentences.en: He was quite a skinny little boy.
sentences.cn: 他是个瘦得皮包骨头的小男孩。

sentences.en: Seaton threw up skinny brown hands.
sentences.cn: 西顿把他那双皮包骨的黝黑的手朝天一摊.

sentences.en: She had stringy hair and skinny legs.
sentences.cn: 她的长发稀疏，毫无光泽，两条腿跟竹竿似的。

sentences.en: Some supermodels are far too skinny.
sentences.cn: 有些超级模特也太瘦骨嶙峋了。

sentences.en: They used to take off their clothes and go skinny dipping in the creek.
sentences.cn: 他们以前常常脱了衣服在小河里裸泳。

sentences.en: This book gives you the skinny on Hollywood.
sentences.cn: 这本书披露了好莱坞的内幕。

sentences.en: You're skinny enough without going on a diet!
sentences.cn: 你不必节食就已经够瘦的了!

sentences.en: You're too skinny — we'll have to fatten you up.
sentences.cn: 你太瘦了，我们要把你养胖些。

words.tran_cn: 剥皮；给…植皮（skin的过去式和过去分词）
机密情报；内部消息；小道消息

trans.tran_cn: 极瘦的，皮包骨的，紧身的，小气的，皮的，皮质的
trans.tran_en: very thin, especially in a way that is unattractive
